column2: Carrot Top, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I experiencec bloating and nausea from the start.  During the process, I also experienced vomiting and had to slow down the process to every 10 minute process to 20-30 minutes.  That worked well so I will keep that in mind for the next time.After the colonscopy procedure, the doctor report iritation in my colon.  My lab work prior to the procedure showed normal labs - or remission for my Ulcerative colitis.  Now I have a flareup and need to take prednisone in addition to my UC medications.  I encourage anyone who has experienced a flareup after use of PEG3350/ electrolytes Oral for a colonscopy preparation to al rate this treatment.

column2: mary, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I mixed this solution with cold water and Gatorade provided as instructed by my physican.  I finished the medication and then felt really bloated and nauseous. I finally started to have bowl movements almost 3 hours later and was up until 3 AM. I still felt nauseous in the morning and had 3 more bowel movments before my colonoscopy at 12:30 PM. I still feel a bit nauseous 24 hours later.

column2: Ineffective, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In my case this drug was grossly ineffective. It just didn't work! After over three hours use, no BM was produced.

column2: POOPEDOUT, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: Male, 71, 6'1", 199 lbs.  I have never consumed anything so vile.  I could hardly keep it down.  Yeah, it did empty my bowels but it shredded by anus in the process.  God bless "Baby Wipes" and Vaseline.

column2: Kkkkkk, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Age 48 female 5'5" 145lbs Tasted like mild solution of baking soda and water8oz at a time is not too muchDrank every 10 min until emptyStayed home drink the day started at noon. First bm at 3. 1st bm ended watery.Continued watery bm'sSurgery tomorrow at noon

column2: sweet n sassy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hard to drink solution every fifteen minutes.
This was so easy, no cramping, very comfortable, what a change from last time!!

column2: Livingstone, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The first few glassfuls were easy, but then it got difficult to keep drinking... tasted awful until I added a few drops of stevia, then it just tasted bad. To make it worse, my stomach bloated, making it even harder to drink. And I'm a 6 foot 200 pound man! I think it'd be really difficult for a lighter individual.

column2: tylerskye, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Made me sick to my stomach. Could only take half before I vomited it and could not keep it down. Took HOURS to work. I was up all night and almost missed my appointment. Start this in the morning or early afternoon. DO NOT WAIT until late afternoon/evening. It takes hours (4-6 or more to start working).

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It makes me feel like I am going to vomit, but I kept it down and now I am constantly running to the bathroom every 5-10 minutes.
